summary: This is a protective order issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The order establishes strict rules governing the handling, use, and disclosure of sensitive discovery materials produced by the government, including confidential witness/victim information and highly confidential sexualized images.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which this protective order is issued. The order restricts her access to and use of discovery materials.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this protective order.

events.title: Issuance of Protective Order
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues a protective order in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell to govern the handling of sensitive discovery materials.

keyFacts: The government's discovery materials include 'Highly Confidential Information' defined as containing 'nude, partially-nude, or otherwise sexualized images, videos, or other depictions of individuals.'
The protective order aims to protect the privacy of victims and witnesses, prevent prejudicial pretrial publicity, and safeguard the government's ongoing investigation.
Ghislaine Maxwell is restricted from possessing discovery materials outside the presence of her defense counsel, especially the 'Highly Confidential Information.'

The order establishes a tiered system for discovery materials: general discovery, 'Confidential Information' (containing personal identification info), and 'Highly Confidential Information' (sexualized images/videos).
The identities of victims or witnesses who have not spoken publicly are to be protected and cannot be filed publicly unless authorized.
